Treatment will cease if your patient tries to sell drugs or encourage drug use by other patients.","properties":{"location":{"column":0,"row":3}},"id":"12"},{"translationKey":"LABEL_13","type":"label","value":"D. I understand that my patient will not be allowed explicit accounts of drug or alcohol use.","properties":{"location":{"column":0,"row":4}},"id":"13"},{"translationKey":"LABEL_14","type":"label","value":"E. The patient should not have romantic or sexual relationships with other patients.","properties":{"location":{"column":0,"row":5}},"id":"14"},{"translationKey":"LABEL_15","type":"label","value":"F. I understand that the patient should not do commercial transactions with other patients and personnel of the institution. CEREPA is not responsible.","properties":{"location":{"column":0,"row":6}},"id":"15"},{"translationKey":"LABEL_16","type":"label","value":"G. Any issue discussed in group sessions and the identity of each group member is absolutely confidential and will not be shared with non-members.","properties":{"location":{"column":0,"row":7}},"id":"16"},{"translationKey":"LABEL_17","type":"label","value":"H. In the case of discharge requests before the stipulated time, you will contact your treating psychologist, to make a formal request and begin due process with family mediation, assuming full responsibility for adverse results of said decision.","properties":{"location":{"column":0,"row":8}},"id":"17"},{"translationKey":"LABEL_18","type":"label","value":"I. It is mandatory to join the Family Matrix class on Sundays from 11:00 am to 12:00 pm.","properties":{"location":{"column":0,"row":9}},"id":"18"},{"translationKey":"LABEL_19","type":"label","value":"J. CEREPA is protected with an electrified perimeter wall for patient safety, so patients should not climb it to avoid damage to their physical integrity.","properties":{"location":{"column":0,"row":1}},"id":"22"}]},{"type":"section","label":{"translationKey":"SECTION_23","type":"label","value":"4. The person representing the patient is responsible for canceling consultations for specialized care, exams, psychiatric care and medications outside the basic scheme that the patient may need during their stay at the center.","properties":{"location":{"column":0,"row":1}},"id":"35"},{"translationKey":"LABEL_36","type":"label","value":"C. In the event that the patient escapes or decides to abandon their treatment or the family member demands that they leave, there will be no refund of the canceled fees, only if the doctor or psychologist refers the patient to another center.","properties":{"location":{"column":0,"row":2}},"id":"36"},{"translationKey":"LABEL_38","type":"label","value":"D. In the event of a leak, CEREPA is not responsible for the physical integrity of the patient. In the event that the patient commits assault on another inmate or any person who is within the centre's facilities, and expenses are incurred, they will be charged to the person directly responsible.","properties":{"location":{"column":0,"row":4}},"id":"39"},{"translationKey":"LABEL_40","type":"label","value":"F. If the patient causes damage to the facilities and furniture of the center, or other objects that are within the premises, the family member will be responsible for paying 100% of the expense incurred for repair or new acquisition that solves the loss.","properties":{"location":{"column":0,"row":5}},"id":"40"},{"translationKey":"LABEL_41","type":"label","value":"G. I accept the following:","id":"42"},"properties":{"addMore":false,"location":{"column":0,"row":9}},"id":"42","controls":[{"translationKey":"LABEL_44","type":"label","value":"A. Before the patient's admission, the family must perform a test for detection of COVID-19, posterior-anterior chest X-ray and complete blood count; In the event of a diagnosis of acute infection and / or infectious period, the admission process to the center should be postponed until the patient has fully recovered from said disease and the infectious period has ended.","properties":{"location":{"column":0,"row":0}},"id":"44"},{"translationKey":"LABEL_45","type":"label","value":"B. In the event of a diagnosis of COVID-19 and / or its complications, during the patient's stay in the center, their rehabilitation program will be suspended to give priority to the stabilization and management of said disease, for which a COVID19 contingency plan will be executed. with the use of insurance funds agreed for this situation and transfer in 24-48 hours, through the Honduran Red Cross to their place of residence, so that the patient receives treatment in the health system of their choice. Once recovered from COVID-19 and the infectious period is over, the patient will be a candidate to rejoin the rehabilitation process.","properties":{"location":{"column":0,"row":1}},"id":"45"},{"translationKey":"LABEL_46","type":"label","value":"C. The patient must remain in the initial Isolation area in the first 8 days of their hospitalization, following the instructions provided by the staff on duty.","properties":{"location":{"column":0,"row":2}},"id":"46"},{"type":"section","label":{"translationKey":"SECTION_48","type":"label","value":"D.","id":"48"},"properties":{"addMore":false,"location":{"column":0,"row":3}},"id":"48","controls":[{"translationKey":"LABEL_49","type":"label","value":"I. Make correct and permanent use of mask","properties":{"location":{"column":0,"row":0}},"id":"49"},{"translationKey":"LABEL_50","type":"label","value":"II. Maintain a distance of 2 meters with other people","properties":{"location":{"column":0,"row":1}},"id":"50"},{"translationKey":"LABEL_51","type":"label","value":"III. Wash your hands constantly with soap and water.","properties":{"location":{"column":0,"row":2}},"id":"51"},{"translationKey":"LABEL_52","type":"label","value":"IV. Application of antiviral-antibacterial gel between and during therapies.","properties":{"location":{"column":0,"row":3}},"id":"52"},{"translationKey":"LABEL_53","type":"label","value":"V. Respect the signs (do not move chairs and / or tables, beds, furniture, etc.). saw. Do not share drinks or food.","properties":{"location":{"column":0,"row":4}},"id":"53"},{"translationKey":"LABEL_54","type":"label","value":"VI. Avoid crowds at all times.","properties":{"location":{"column":0,"row":5}},"id":"54"},{"translationKey":"LABEL_55","type":"label","value":"VII. Complying with any other measure or indication provided, in relation to the prevention of COVID-19 infections, failure to do so may incur penalties and finally the suspension of the rehabilitation program.CEREPA no se hace responsable por contagio de pacientes con COVID-19 durante el proceso de rehabilitación en adicciones, ni de complicaciones relacionadas al mismo.","properties":{"location":{"column":0,"row":6}},"id":"55"}]},{"translationKey":"LABEL_57","type":"label","value":"E. CEREPA is not responsible for contagion of patients with COVID-19 during the addiction rehabilitation process, or for complications related to it.","properties":{"location":{"column":0,"row":4}},"id":"57"}]},{"type":"section","label":{"translationKey":"SECTION_59","type":"label","value":"Agreement","id":"59"},"properties":{"addMore":false,"location":{"column":0,"row":10}},"id":"59","controls":[{"translationKey":"LABEL_60","type":"label","value":"The patient manager certifies that he or she has read, understood and accepted this agreement and consent for services. labels.LABEL_2: The inpatient treatment program, in which I agree to participate, is based on the Clare Matrix Intensive Drug and Alcohol Treatment program. Program staff believe that the treatment strategies used provide a helpful intervention for dependency problems. A specific result is not guaranteed
labels.LABEL_9: A. It is necessary to arrive at the appointments at the indicated time. At some visits my patient will have urine or breath alcohol tests.
labels.LABEL_7: Participation in the treatment requires certain basic rules. These conditions are essential for successful treatment. Breaking these rules may lead to termination of patient treatment.
labels.LABEL_49: I. Make correct and permanent use of mask
labels.LABEL_28: All information shared in these sessions is strictly confidential. Such information may not be disclosed to anyone other than clinic staff without the written authorization of the patient or the patient's family. The only exceptions are those in which the law requires or permits the disclosure of information, and these are usually situations that involve a serious risk of physical harm to oneself or others, or a suspicion of abuse of children or of seniors.
labels.LABEL_26: In order to ensure the high level of quality of services and training in the clinic, therapy sessions may be videotaped or audio recorded for training and safety purposes. . The patient and, if applicable, the patient's family give permission for sessions to be viewed and videotaped or recorded for that purpose.
labels.LABEL_45: B. In the event of a diagnosis of COVID-19 and / or its complications, during the patient's stay in the center, their rehabilitation program will be suspended to give priority to the stabilization and management of said disease, for which a COVID19 contingency plan will be executed. with the use of insurance funds agreed for this situation and transfer in 24-48 hours, through the Honduran Red Cross to their place of residence, so that the patient receives treatment in the health system of their choice. Once recovered from COVID-19 and the infectious period is over, the patient will be a candidate to rejoin the rehabilitation process.
labels.LABEL_46: C. The patient must remain in the initial Isolation area in the first 8 days of their hospitalization, following the instructions provided by the staff on duty.
labels.LABEL_24: Services are provided by psychologists, licensed counselors, therapists, or other personnel trained in the field of addiction. All unlicensed therapists work under the supervision of a licensed therapist trained in the field of addiction treatment.
labels.LABEL_21: A. In the event of aggression or insubordination by the patient, if necessary, CEREPA staff will use pepper spray, with immediate notification to the PREDISAN organizational security system and the involvement of the Secretary of National Security.
labels.LABEL_44: A. Before the patient's admission, the family must perform a test for detection of COVID-19, posterior-anterior chest X-ray and complete blood count; In the event of a diagnosis of acute infection and / or infectious period, the admission process to the center should be postponed until the patient has fully recovered from said disease and the infectious period has ended.
labels.LABEL_22: B. CEREPA is protected with an electrified perimeter wall for patient safety, so patients should not climb it to avoid damage to their physical integrity.
labels.LABEL_41: G. If the patient causes damage to the facilities and furniture of the center, or other objects that are within the premises, the family member will be responsible for paying 100% of the expense incurred for repair or new acquisition that solves the loss.
labels.LABEL_40: F. If the patient causes damage to the facilities and furniture of the center, or other objects that are within the premises, the family member will be responsible for paying 100% of the expense incurred for repair or new acquisition that solves the loss.
labels.LABEL_60: The patient manager certifies that he or she has read, understood and accepted this agreement and consent for services. This agreement and consent will govern all the time that the patient participates in the treatment activities of this center.
labels.LABEL_18: I. It is mandatory to join the Family Matrix class on Sundays from 11:00 am to 12:00 pm.
labels.LABEL_19: J. I understand that I must not introduce any type of prohibited substances or objects, including money, to the facilities of the center, that could affect the process of rehabilitation of inpatients, which will be subject to sanctions.
labels.LABEL_38: D. In the event of a leak, CEREPA is not responsible for the physical integrity of the patient. However, CEREPA will follow security protocols notifying the local police station and the family.
labels.LABEL_16: G. Any issue discussed in group sessions and the identity of each group member is absolutely confidential and will not be shared with non-members.
labels.LABEL_39: E. In the event that the patient commits assault on another inmate or any person who is within the centre's facilities, and expenses are incurred, they will be charged to the person directly responsible.
labels.LABEL_17: H. In the case of discharge requests before the stipulated time, you will contact your treating psychologist, to make a formal request and begin due process with family mediation, assuming full responsibility for adverse results of said decision.
labels.LABEL_36: C. In the event that the patient escapes or decides to abandon their treatment or the family member demands that they leave, there will be no refund of the canceled fees, only if the doctor or psychologist refers the patient to another center.
labels.LABEL_14: E. The patient should not have romantic or sexual relationships with other patients.
labels.LABEL_15: F. I understand that the patient should not do commercial transactions with other patients and personnel of the institution. CEREPA is not responsible.
labels.LABEL_34: A. The daily cost of the treatment is L 1200.00, in case of expulsion of the patient, the days that he stayed in the center will be charged according to the actual daily cost.
labels.LABEL_12: C. Treatment will cease if your patient tries to sell drugs or encourage drug use by other patients.
labels.SECTION_42: Biosecurity measures due to COVID-19 pandemic. I accept the following:
labels.LABEL_57: E. CEREPA is not responsible for contagion of patients with COVID-19 during the addiction rehabilitation process, or for complications related to it.
labels.LABEL_35: B. The person representing the patient is responsible for canceling consultations for specialized care, exams, psychiatric care and medications outside the basic scheme that the patient may need during their stay at the center.
labels.LABEL_13: D. I understand that my patient will not be allowed explicit accounts of drug or alcohol use.
labels.LABEL_54: VI. Avoid crowds at all times.
labels.LABEL_55: VII. Complying with any other measure or indication provided, in relation to the prevention of COVID-19 infections, failure to do so may incur penalties and finally the suspension of the rehabilitation program.CEREPA no se hace responsable por contagio de pacientes con COVID-19 durante el proceso de rehabilitación en adicciones, ni de complicaciones relacionadas al mismo.
labels.LABEL_11: B. Treatment conditions require abstaining from all drugs or alcohol for the duration of the program.
labels.LABEL_52: IV. Application of antiviral-antibacterial gel between and during therapies.
labels.SECTION_25: 5. Consent to video or audio recording
labels.LABEL_53: V. Respect the signs (do not move chairs and / or tables, beds, furniture, etc.). saw. Do not share drinks or food.
labels.LABEL_31: Achieving treatment goals requires the cooperation and active participation of patients and their families. Lack of cooperation on the part of the patient or family members can seriously interfere with the clinic's ability to effectively serve the patient and others. In such circumstances, the clinic may cease to provide services to the patient.
labels.LABEL_50: II. Maintain a distance of 2 meters with other people
labels.LABEL_51: III. Wash your hands constantly with soap and water.

concepts.IMAGE_61: Full Name and Fingerprint of Relative
